summary: This document is an email draft from Sigrid McCawley, likely an attorney, to an unspecified recipient. In it, she recounts contacting the FBI about Jeffrey Epstein and being advised to bring evidence to the FBI unit at the US Embassy, but was later warned not to do so as she might lose her evidence. The email appears to reference coordination with another person named Peter.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Author of the email draft, recounting her contact with the FBI regarding Jeffrey Epstein and being advised about evidence handling.

persons.name: Jeffrey
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the information Sigrid McCawley provided to the FBI, implicitly Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Peter
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who got in touch with the recipient(s) ('you guys') just before Sigrid McCawley contacted the FBI.

connections.description: Sigrid McCawley contacted the FBI to inform them about Jeffrey (Epstein).
Sigrid's actions followed Peter's contact with the email's recipients.

events.title: Email Draft Regarding FBI Contact
events.description: Sigrid McCawley drafts an email recounting her contact with the US FBI about Jeffrey Epstein, being told to bring evidence to the US Embassy, and then being warned not to.

keyFacts: Sigrid McCawley contacted the US FBI regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
She was initially instructed to take all her evidence to the FBI unit at the US Embassy.
She was subsequently warned not to go, as she was told the FBI would take all her evidence and she would never see it again.
This communication occurred around July 24, 2019, and references prior coordination with a person named Peter.
